1.text: And the Lord visited Sara, as he had promised: and fulfilled what he had spoken.

2.text: And she conceived and bore a son in her old age, at the time that God had foretold her.

3.text: And Abraham called the name of his son, whom Sara bore him, Isaac.

4.text: And he circumcised him the eighth day, as God had commanded him,

5.text: When he was a hundred years old: for at this age of his father was Isaac born.

6.text: And Sara said: God hath made a laughter for me: whosoever shall hear of it will laugh with me.

7.text: And again she said: Who would believe that Abraham should hear that Sara gave suck to a son, whom she bore to him in his old age.

8.text: And the child grew and was weaned: and Abraham made a great feast on the day of his weaning.

9.text: And when Sara had seen the son of Agar the Egyptian playing with Isaac her son, she said to Abraham:

10.text: Cast out this bondwoman, and her son: for the son of the bondwoman shall not be heir with my son Isaac.

11.text: Abraham took this grievously for his son.

12.text: And God said to him: Let it not seem grievous to thee for the boy, and for thy bondwoman: in all that Sara hath said to thee, hearken to her voice: for in Isaac shall thy seed be called.

13.text: But I will make the son also of the bondwoman a great nation, because he is thy seed.

14.text: So Abraham rose up in the morning, and taking bread and a bottle of water, put it upon her shoulder, and delivered the boy, and sent her away. And she departed, and wandered in the wilderness of Bersabee.

15.text: And when the water in the bottle was spent, she cast the boy under one of the trees that were there.

16.text: And she went her way, and sat over against him a great way off as far as a bow can carry, for she said: I will not see the boy die: and sitting over against, she lifted up her voice and wept.

17.text: And God heard the voice of the boy: and an angel of God called to Agar from heaven, saying: What art thou doing, Agar? fear not: for God hath heard the voice of the boy, from the place wherein he is.

18.text: Arise, take up the boy, and hold him by the hand: for I will make him a great nation.

19.text: And God opened her eyes: and she saw a well of water, and went and filled the bottle, and gave the boy to drink.

20.text: And God was with him: and he grew, and dwelt in the wilderness, and became a young man, an archer.

21.text: And he dwelt in the wilderness of Pharan, and his mother took a wife for him out of the land of Egypt.

22.text: At the same time Abimelech, and Phicol the general of his army said to Abraham: God is with thee in all that thou dost.

23.text: Swear therefore by God, that thou wilt not hurt me, nor my posterity, nor my stock: but according to the kindness that I have done to thee, thou shalt do to me, and to the land wherein thou hast lived a stranger.

24.text: And Abraham said: I will swear.

25.text: And he reproved Abimelech for a well of water, which his servants had taken away by force.

26.text: And Abimelech answered: I knew not who did this thing: and thou didst not tell me, and I heard not of it till to day.

27.text: And Abraham took sheep and oxen and gave them to Abimelech: and both of them made a league.

28.text: And Abraham set apart seven ewe lambs of the flock.

29.text: And Abimelech said to him: What mean these seven ewe lambs which thou hast set apart?

30.text: But he said: Thou shalt take seven ewe lambs at my hand: that they may be a testimony for me, that I dug this well.

31.text: Therefore that place was called Bersabee: because both of them did swear.

32.text: And they made a league for the well of oath.

33.text: And Abimelech, and Phicol the general of his army arose and returned to the land of the Palestines. But Abraham planted a grove in Bersabee, and there called upon the name of the Lord God eternal.

34.text: And he was a sojourner in the land of the Palestines many days.
